news_list.title: West Bengal Police cracks down on anti-India social media posts; accused arrested from many places
news_list.description: India-Pakistan ceasefire has been raging on the west side of India, police have said in a statement to the Hindus' daily news service The Hindus have arrested six to eight people over the past few days for making posts on social media that indicated anti-India sentiments or any mischief and were made from Balagarh, Asansol, Howrah, Barasat, Bankura and Uttar Dinajpur.

news_list.title: ₹10 crore allotted for Aluva Market Road widening
news_list.description: A road-widening project has been approved by the Ministry of Public Works (MoU) to widen a 350-metre-long stretch of Aluva Market Road, it has been announced in a press conference on Thursday. It is expected to cost 6.75 crore for the project, which will be completed by 2021. The project would also improve the commercial prospects of the market, the minister said.

news_list.title: U.S.-China trade agreement a mixed bag for India, say trade experts
news_list.description: US and China have agreed to reduce tariffs on Chinese goods to 30% from the 145% it raised them to, according to a joint statement issued by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in Geneva. The two countries also said they will continue talks to further work out their trade issues with each other over the next few months. It is not clear how the deal would affect India’s exports, but experts say it could help boost exports in sectors that remain relatively

news_list.title: Bound by a thread: Tendulkar recalls Kohli's special gesture on retirement day
news_list.description: Sachin Tendulkar has died at the age of 84, after his father's death in Mumbai on May 12 and his son Virat Kohli's last Test against India in 2025 was abandoned by Indian cricket legend Virat Kotanayev to become one of the world's most famous cricketers for 21 years before becoming the first man to be named as the "Master Blaster" in the country.

news_list.title: NTR Collector sanctions tricycle to physically challenged person in one hour
news_list.description: Mr. Lakshmisha, who was about to proceed to Tiruvuru, observed Thambi crawling on the Collectorate premises. “As both my legs are paralysed, I was unable to do any work. Please sanction a tricycle for me,” Mr. Thambi told the Collector and showed his Aadhaar Card and Physically Handicapped certificate issued by the government.

news_list.title: Need collective efforts to develop Tiruvuru Assembly constituency: Vijayawada MP
news_list.description: Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath stressed the need for collective efforts to develop Tiruvuru Assembly constituency, and pledged his support to achieve the developmental goals of PGRS programme. He said people need not travel to the NTR district headquarters to have their issues resolved as they could approach the officials locally under the PGSC. Mr. Sivanama said that a total of 278 petitions were received during

news_list.title: Committee to be formed for amendments to Cooperative Societies Act in Maharashtra, says CM Fadnavis
news_list.description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Monday (May 12, 2025) announced the formation of a committee to look into amendments to the Maharashttra Cooperative Societies Act, 1960. The Union Minister of Road Transport Nitin Gadkari recommends the formulation of new law for the cooperative sector in the State to factor evolving economic conditions and market competition. Mr. Gadcari also suggested a detailed study to examine the socio

news_list.title: False promise of marriage’ untenable after live-in relationship for years: SC
news_list.description: A court in Uttarakhand has refused to quash the case of a man accused of having forcible sex with a woman he had entered into a settlement deed affirming their mutual love and intention to marry each other, the Supreme Court has said. It is not clear whether it was an allegation that such a relationship was entered into because there was a promise of marriage in the circumstances unworthy of acceptance.

news_list.title: KEA launches three student-friendly digital platforms
news_list.description: The Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA) launched three digital initiatives on Monday. These include a portal that gives all relevant information about colleges in the State, a mobile app that provides all services, and an Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered chatbot. It was launched a few days ago and since then, over 1.35 lakh students have used it to seek information. They have been using it for years.

news_list.title: IPL to resume on May 17, final on June 3
news_list.description: The Indian Premier League (IPL) will play the remaining 17 matches from May 17 to June 3 in Jaipur on May 24, 2025, according to a revised schedule for the remainder of the TATA IPL 2025. A total of 17 matches will be played across 6 venues, starting May 17, and culminating in the final on June 3, with Chennai and Hyderabad missing from the list. It is not clear how long it will take for the remaining 13 league games to be played

news_list.title: Modi’s address silent on Trump’s claim of U.S. averting nuclear conflict by threatening to stop trade: Congress
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s address to the nation was completely upstaged by President Trump’s revelations a few minutes earlier. The PM was completely silent on them. Has India agreed to U.S. mediation? Has India agree to a ‘neutral site’ for a dialogue with Pakistan? Will India now give in on US demands for opening Indian markets in autos, agriculture, and other areas?” Mr. Ramesh asked in a post

news_list.title: Untouchability is being practised in the country in myriad ways, says Madras High Court
news_list.description: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy denounced caste as a form of untouchability in the country, saying it is “not accepting the donation from a person perceived to be an inferior human being is another form,” the judge said. The Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) Department has decided to dispose of a representation made by the writ petitioner for accepting donations from all willing donors.

news_list.title: 86,000 ‘excess deaths’ in West Bengal in 2021; four times official Covid casualties
news_list.description: South 24 Parganas (+11,250), and Hooghly (+13,250) have recorded the highest annual spike in deaths in West Bengal from 2020 to 2021, according to a report released by the Central Government of India. The country's population is estimated to be at around 86,736 under the age of 18, more than double the official COVID-19 death toll for the state in 2021.

news_list.title: BJP’s politics is hybrid and Congress politics is national: Jagga Reddy
news_list.description: TPCC working president T. Jagga Reddy invoked the leadership of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, praising her decisive role during the 1971 India-Pakistan war and said the BJP is still trying to undermine her contribution in winning wars. Speaking to reporters at Gandhi Bhavan on Monday, Mr. Reddy said that even during the present Indo-Pak conflict Indian’s courage was being discussed to teach Pakistan a lesson. He

news_list.title: Chief Minister meets Governor to appraise him of situation in Telangana
news_list.description: A Revanth Reddy met Governor Jishnu Dev Varma on Monday morning and discussed with him various issues concerning the State in the backdrop of the Indo-Pak conflict and how the State was on alert to deal with any situation. The Chief Minister is said to have requested the Governor to clear the file related to the appointment of the Information Commissioners that was pending at Raj Bhavan for the last few days. Interestingly, a few hours after the

news_list.title: Australia, Bangladesh, Nepal welcome ‘understanding’ to pause firing and military action between India and Pakistan
news_list.description: Australia has welcomed the “understanding” between India and Pakistan to stop firing and military action on the Line of Control and the International Border (IB) that was reached on May 10 amidst tense circumstances, Foreign Minister Penny Wong held a telephone call with External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar and Pakistan’s Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar, describing the process of de-escalation as ‘critical to regional peace and security’

news_list.title: India, Pakistan to cut troops on borders
news_list.description: India-Pakistan ceasefire” was agreed during talks between the Directors-General of Military Operations (DGMOs) of the two countries that were held on the established hotline at 5 p.m. “Issues related to continuing the commitment that both sides must not fire a single shot or initiate any aggressive and inimical action against each other were discussed,” the Army said. While that was violated by Pakistan within few hours, guns fell silent

news_list.title: Chouhan reviews kharif sowing; increase in paddy, pulses acreage
news_list.description: Sowing of paddy, pulses, coarse grains and oilseeds has expanded this kharif season, said the Agriculture Ministry in New Delhi on Monday (May 12, 2025), after a meeting chaired by Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. As on May 2, sowing of panda had increased by 3.44 lakh hectares while the sowing area of potato has also increased by 0.47 lakh tonnes.

news_list.title: Shah Rukh Khan enjoyed watching Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2, says Kartik Aaryan: ‘He always discusses my films…’
news_list.description: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 is among the highest-grossing films of 2022, according to Kartik Aaryan and Kangana Ranaut in a recent interview with Filmfare. The film received acclaim from all quarters, with several actors—including Kanganara Ranaut—praising Kartik for drawing audiences back to theatres. It was also among the most-grosesing films by 2022.

news_list.title: When Virat said, ‘I get a good feel coming to Visakhapatnam, it is similar to Adelaide
news_list.description: Visakhapatnam celebrate the first ever Test match between India and England at Dr. YSR ACA-VDCA Stadium, unveiling a commemorative pylon and presenting mementoes to both Indian and English players. It was a historic day for the Andhra Cricket Association (ACA) and the cricket fans of Andhran Pradesh. The red ball cricket had arrived in the region for the first time, drawing thousands from across the state

news_list.title: Tata Steel Q4 net profit more than doubles to ₹1,301 crore
news_list.description: Tata Steel Ltd. has posted a net profit of 1,301 crore in the year-earlier period. Revenue from operations during the period declined 5% YoY to 55,707 crore. The Board of Directors recommended a dividend for 3.60 per ordinary (equity) share of face value of $1 each. Tata Tiscon achieved best-ever volumes and grew by 19% YoY at around 2.4 million tonnes.

news_list.title: ‘Kalpana never got the recognition she deserved from cinema,’ says sister Urvashi: ‘She would have received many good roles today’
news_list.description: Urvashi’s ad, “Kalpana should have been alive today,” she said in an exclusive conversation with SCREEN. ‘She influenced me in every way. As actors, all our mannerisms came from our mother. Even when talking at home or on the phone, one couldn’t tell if it’s mom, me or Kalpana. In Tamil Nadu, it's easy for the people to recognise because mom and

news_list.title: BCRC seeks remuneration review of Bank Mitras
news_list.description: Banks & Bank Mitras have appealed to Parliamentary Committee on Finance to review the remuneration of bankers and seek subsidy on their infrastructure costs, an industry body has told BBC Radio 4's Business Correspondent Resource Council (BCRC) has said in a letter to Prime Minister Bhartruhari Mahtab that it is not necessary to revise the rate for ATM interoperability charges.

news_list.title: F1 trailer: Brad Pitt plays ‘oldtimer’ who needs to deal with both his past and a rookie to save his friend’s struggling APXGP team
news_list.description: Brad Pitt and Lewis Hamilton are set to play the role of Sonny Hayes, a former Formula 1 driver who returns to the sport after a devastating crash decades earlier. The film is set to release worldwide on June 25. It stars Brad Pitt in the lead role, which is directed by Top Gun: Maverick director Joseph Kosinski. A trailer for F1's first season will be released on June 26.

news_list.title: Gradiente Infotainment to invest ₹5,000 crore in scalable media ventures
news_list.description: Gradiente Infotainment Ltd. will invest 5,000 crore in the next three years across India and the MENA region to boost media and culture initiatives, the company said in a statement. The company told The Hindu that it would explore a public float in March 2026 to raise 1,000 crore. It would also raise funds from High Net Worth Individuals and avail debt from financial institutions. “We are a listed company on Calcutta

news_list.title: Is US-China trade deal good news for India or bad? Experts say…
news_list.description: The US and China have reached a deal to reduce the tariffs on Chinese goods for 90 days, according to India’s Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) President SC Ralhan said in a news conference at the country’s headquarters in Beijing. “We must actively engage with the US to secure and expand its preferential trade access, emphasising its role as a reliable alternative sourcing destination,” he said.

news_list.title: Sunita Ahuja says she feels bad seeing husband Govinda sitting at home: ‘Anil Kapoor, Suniel Shetty, Jackie Shroff are doing so much work…’
news_list.description: Sunita Ahuja, a major star in the 1990s, has declined opportunities in the OTT space and is worried about his family’s wish to see Govinda return to the big screen. But she said: “I keep asking him to have better company. Why is a legend like you sitting at home? Actors of your age are doing so much work, including Anil Kapoor, Suniel Shetty, and Jackie Sh

news_list.title: 'We stopped a nuclear conflict': Trump again claims credit for India-Pakistan 'ceasefire'
news_list.description: President Donald Trump on Monday again claimed the credit for India-Pakistan ‘ceasefire’, saying that US intervention prevented a “bad nuclear war” between the rivals. “We stopped a nuclear conflict. I think it could have been a bad nuclear war, millions of people could have be killed. So I’m very proud of that,” AFP quoted Trump as telling reporters at the White House. Trump said his administration helped broker what may be a permanent

news_list.title: Myanmar airstrike on school kills at least 22; dozens injured in bombing
news_list.description: A military airstrike carried out by Myanmarâs junta on Monday struck a school in the central Sagaing region, leaving at least 20 students and two teachers dead, according to a resistance group member, an aid worker, and media accounts. The strike occurred in the morning in Ohe Htein Twin village, located in Tabayin township, also known as Depayin in Singapore, May12, 2025.

news_list.title: Zeenat Aman says Rishi Kapoor kept his distance, was bothered by her height: ‘Nasir Saab propped him up on two cushions…’
news_list.description: Zeenat Aman has appeared in more than 80 films since the 1970s, starring Dharmendra, Dev Anand, Amitabh Bachchan, Rishi Kapoor, and Nasir Hussain’s Hum Kisise Kum Naheen. The actress also shared a rare song and a flirtatious scene she filmed with Rishi, revealing that he was quite irritated by their height difference

news_list.title: Kohli had made up his mind to quit longer format: sources
news_list.description: Virat Kohli’s decision to retire from Test cricket may have been a surprise for Indian cricket fans, according to an official source in the country's National Cricket League (NRL) news agency. The former India batsman is believed to have made up his mind to let the younger lot take over ahead of the new World Test Championship cycle at the end of last month. But it was not clear whether he would be willing to reconsider his decision.

news_list.title: After Zelenskyy's 'Putin should attend in Person' remark, Kremlin says serious about talks but offers no details
news_list.description: The Kremlin said on Monday that President Vladimir Putin is genuinely committed to pursuing peace through direct talks with Ukraine but declined to provide further details after Ukraine insisted that the Russian leader attend the talks in person. On Sunday, Putin proposed direct talks in Turkey aimed at ending the conflict. US President Donald Trump publicly told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to accept, but Zelnskyy said he would but that Putin should attend in person

news_list.title: Kohli changed the culture of Indian cricket, says childhood coach Rajkumar
news_list.description: Virat Kohli, 59, was at his best as a Test batter when he retired from the Tests in 2014-15, according to India's cricket coach Rajkumar Sharma. But it wasn't all that easy for him to get out of the country and win matches for the country. "I think he should still play till the 2027 ODI World Cup," he told The Hindu on Monday.

news_list.title: Amid beating from India, Baloch rebels also claim 71 attacks on Pakistani forces
news_list.description: Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) has said that it has conducted 71 coordinated attacks at 51 locations in its ongoing ‘Operation Herof’. Read more Militant tribemen carry their weapons during routine training in the autonomous region of Kohlu in the southeast of Balochistan province. The BLA is the primary armed group part of the self-determination movement of the Baloch people. India has devastated at least eight airbases of Pakistan in addition

news_list.title: India extends $50 million financial support to debt-ridden Maldives
news_list.description: India says it has extended financial support to the Maldives by rolling over New Delhiâs subscription to a $50 million treasury bill by another year at the request of the archipelago's government. The State Bank of India has extended the subscription to the bill issued by the Maldivian finance ministry, India’s high commission there said in a statement on its X account.

news_list.title: Stormy Sea, Xanthe, Kavya and Dreamer excel
news_list.description: In fine condition, Blue Picasso (Saqlian), Palma (Chetan K) 1-13, 600/43. Moved on the bit. Luna (Dhebe), Tropical Paradise (N.S. Parmar) 1-30, 1,000/1-15, 600/44.5. They moved on a bit. Morano (Tejeshwar) 1-29, 1000/1-14.5, 600/35.5.

news_list.title: Cricket Australia will back Australian players who don't want to return to India for IPL
news_list.description: Australia's players have been urged to return to the Indian Premier League after the suspension of the IPL, according to a report by the Sydney Morning Herald (Sydney Morning Herald) in London. The Australians are also concerned about the prospect of being frozen out of future editions of the International Cricket Council (IPL), which is set to resume next week. It is not clear how long it will take for them to return.

news_list.title: Netanyahu delinks safe passage of American hostage from Gaza truce, says not agreed to ceasefire with Hamas
news_list.description: Hamas is set to release Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander from Gaza on Monday, the Palestinian militant group said, although Israel’s prime minister said there would be no ceasefire and plans for an intensified military campaign would continue. Fighting will pause to allow for Alexander’s safe passage, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, a day after Israel was told of Hammas’ decision to free the last surviving U.S. hostage in Gaza as a good

news_list.title: Markets log biggest single-day gains as border tensions ease, U.S.-China lower tariffs
news_list.description: Sensex and Nifty’s biggest single-day gains in absolute terms on Monday (May 12, 2025), as border tensions eased and the U.S. and China agreed to lower tariffs on Chinese imports, according to analysts at the New York Stock Exchange's Wall Street Journal. The day was the second-best day for Indian bourses since April 9, 2020, when Nifty 50 rose almost 4%.

news_list.title: LTIMindtree bags $450 million multi-year deal from a global agribusiness firm
news_list.description: LTIMindtree, a Bengaluru-based tech firm, said it secured a $450 million multi-year deal from a leader in the global agribusiness sector. This deal marks a pivotal milestone as we transform to an AI driven business model, helping our clients enhance productivity,” said Venu Lambu, Chief Executive Officer (Designate) and Whole-Time Director, Ltimindree.

news_list.title: Kohli lent heart and spine to Tests
news_list.description: Virat Kohli was a great cricketer, but his form and fielding remain top-notch all through his career. He is one of India’s most influential players in the history of Indian cricket. But it is not easy to step in at number four for India, a spot made special by Sachin Tendulkar, who hustled his singles and twos and quickly moved to his 30s. It is never easy to follow up with Javed Mi

news_list.title: In late-night address, Pakistan admits damage to its fighter aircraft in India’s Operation Sindoor
news_list.description: Pakistanâs military has admitted that at least one of its aircraft suffered âminor damageâ in the military confrontation with India, without giving more information about the jet's name. The two countries agreed to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea, with immediate effect. It is not clear whether Indian pilot was in custody of Pakistan or any Indian pilot who was involved in the incident. Officials of the air force and navy have said they are

news_list.title: Kurdish armed group PKK disbands itself, ends 40-year fight against Turkey
news_list.description: The Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK), which has been fighting the Turkish state for over 40 years, has decided to disband and end its armed struggle, Firat news agency reports. This decision is expected to bring major political and security changes in the region, including in Iraq and Syria, where Kurdish forces work with US troops and have key stronghold. It is seen as a major step towards peace and stability in the area.

news_list.title: U.S., China take step back from sky-high tariffs, agree to pause for 90 days for more talks
news_list.description: U.S. and Chinese officials said Monday (May 12, 2025) they had reached a deal to roll back most of their recent tariffs and call a 90-day truce in their trade war for more talks on resolving their trade disputes. Stock markets rose sharply as the globe’s two major economic powers took a step back from a clash that has unsettled the global economy. The US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said the U

news_list.title: China, US call trade truce, agree to lower reciprocal tariffs by 115% for 90 days
news_list.description: The United States and China have reached an agreement to significantly reduce their reciprocal tariffs for a period of 90 days, as announced in a joint statement following two days of trade talks in Geneva, Switzerland. “We have met an agreement on a 90-day pause,” US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told reporters after the announcement. He said that both sides will move their tariffs down by 115 per cent. This means that US tariffs on Chinese goods will come

news_list.title: Indian pharma stocks fall as Trump moves to cut U.S. drug prices
news_list.description: U.S. stocks fell 1.6% on Monday (May 12, 2025), bucking broader market gains, after US President Donald Trump said he would cut drug prices by 30%–80% to match other wealthy nations.Meanwhile, India's pharma sub-index fell 2.5%, led by Sun Pharma’s 4.6% drop, even as the Nifty 50 gained 2.5%; Zydus Life and Cipla also fell 0.7% each.

news_list.title: Reliance NU Energies bags 350 MW solar project from SJVN Limited
news_list.description: Reliance Power has secured a 350 megawatt (MW) solar project with a 175 MW/700 MWh of battery energy storage system. The winning tariff was set at 3.33/kWh, fixed for 25 years, positioning the project among the most competitively priced offerings in India's energy transition landscape, a company statement said. SJVN, one of the leading Navratna Public Sector Enterprises, had floated the tender

news_list.title: Kohli brings an end to decorated Test career
news_list.description: Virat Kohli, the 36-year-old says he’s not ready to step away from the Test format for the next five-Test series in England on June 20. “I’m walking away with a heart full of gratitude—for the game, for the people I shared the field with, and for every single person who made me feel seen along the way,” he wrote in an Instagram post Monday (May 12, 2025)

news_list.title: Trump offers to mediate on Kashmir: Does India need a middleman?
news_list.description: US President Donald Trump’s offer to mediate the Kashmir flashpoint between India and Pakistan has been met with a familiar and unequivocal response from New Delhi: no third-party involvement. While the US and Pakistan welcomed the idea of mediation, India maintained its long-standing position that any talks, if held, must remain strictly bilateral and bound by the Simla Agreement. No mediation, only PoK to Be discussed New Delhiâs response to Trumpâ

The information provided by Chaudhry matched perfectly with the details of Hafiz Abdul Rauf in the sanctions database of the US government.

news_list.title: World Squash Championships: Indians exit in second round
news_list.description: Anahat Singh lost 1-3 to Fayrouz Aboelkheir of Egypt in the second round of the World Squash Championships held in Chicago on Sunday (May 11, 2025) in the first round. The 17-year-old Indian had earlier beaten world No. 28 American Marina Stefanoni in the opening round, but eventually lost the match 7-11, 11-8, 4-11, 3-11.

news_list.title: Stock Markets open on a high note, Sensex up over 2.3%
news_list.description: Sensex and Nifty rebounded sharply in early trade on Monday (May 12, 2025) after India and Pakistan announced reaching an agreement to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea. The stock Markets openedon a high note with SenseX moving up over 2.3% as clarity emerged on the war from Sunday (May 11, 2025). Also the trade deal announcement between United States and the United Kindgom and reports that U.S.

news_list.title: 'This is a tissue': France clarifies after far-right's claim of Macron, others sniffing cocaine
news_list.description: France and Russia have issued a clarification after far-right, pro-Russia accounts circulated a photo with the claim that French President Emmanuel Macron and other European leaders were sniffing cocaine in a train. In a display of European unity in support of Ukraine, Macron and British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer, new German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, and Polish PM Donald Tusk, visited Kyiv on Saturday and held talks with President Volodymyr

news_list.title: 'Characteristic hyperbole': Indian officials on Trump social media post about US role in ceasefire
news_list.description: Indian officials have dismissed Trump's claim of US-brokered India-Pakistan ceasefire as âcharacteristic hyperboleâ, saying the truce was reached directly between the two nations militaries, with no third-party mediation and not through US mediation. It is also clear that the United States acknowledged the impact of its military response on India and Pakistan, but has denied any role in media coverage.

news_list.title: ‘Cannons for bullets’: PM Modi set Op Sindoor rulebook for Pak actions, officials say ‘new normal’
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called Pakistan’s nuclear bluff with Operation Sindoor, sending a clear message to state-backed terrorists that no one is safe and no place in Pakistan is beyond reach for their elimination, news agency PTI reported. Through this operation, India has established a “new normal” in dealing with Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism. Sources said PM NarendraModi instructed the armed forces to ensure that any pro

news_list.title: Not easy to diversify investment
news_list.description: Statistically speaking, you should look at how a new investment you want to make is statistically related to what you already have in your portfolio. Look at how the mid-cap fund’s returns correlated to the large-cap Fund’s return in the past. Do the same exercise between equity and bond returns. Ask the person giving the suggestion on how to do it. Remember that diversification is more about the statistical relationship between investments, not the number of investments you hold

And how do you feel about your job as a prosecutor? It’s hard to find a way to earn money. If you don’t have a lot of money, then you’re not going to get that kind of salary.

news_list.title: The importance of Small Savings Schemes

It is in line with G-Sec rate movements, which reflect actual and anticipated economic events pertaining to interest rate movement. news_list.title: Foreign investors inject ₹14,167 crore in equities this month
news_list.description: India-Pakistan ceasefire, has boosted investor confidence in the country’s equity market, according to data from depositories. It is also seen as a sign of a strengthening U.S.-India trade agreement with the United States and Pakistan. The latest flow has helped narrow the outflow to 98,184 crore in 2025 so far this month. This positive momentum follows a net investment of 4,223 crore in April, marking

news_list.title: India, EU to hold next round of FTA talks from May 12
news_list.description: India and the European Union (EU) chief negotiators will begin the next round of talks on the proposed free trade agreement (FTA) here from Monday (May 12, 2025), with an aim to conclude the first phase of the agreement as early as possible, according to an official. The two sides have agreed to conclu the agreement in two phases on account of the uncertain global trade environment, particularly due to the U.S. tariff actions under President Donald Trump.

news_list.title: Physiotherapy curriculum uses ‘outdated’ and ‘derogatory’ terms for disabled, say doctors
news_list.description: National Commission for Allied and Healthcare Professions (NCAHP), which has criticised the new curriculum handbook for physiotherapy for using outdated, derogatory terms for the disabled and for reducing disability to management and treatment. The letter said: ‘The new curriculum reduces humanistic learning to optional "soft skills”, ignoring global trends and Indian initiatives that emphasize the centrality of humanities in health professions education.

news_list.title: Russia adds 2,000 medical seats for Indian students: Consul General Valerii Khodzhaev
news_list.description: Russia's government and the country's national medical commission to provide a robust learning environment for Indian students seeking medical education abroad, an event in Chennai has been said to mark the start of a new round of international competitions that will see more than 200 Indian students enrolling in Russian universities this year. It is also expected to be held in Coimbatore, Salem and Tiruchirappalli as part of the All-India Russian Education Fair.

news_list.title: Hyderabad woman resurrects MBBS dream, writes NEET-UG with daughter
news_list.description: A resident of Manchyanayak thanda in Tungaturthi mandal in Suryapet district, Sarita is willing to reappear for the exam next year, if she doesn't make it this time. "It's not like I haven't made it yet," she wrote on NEET-UG. She said: "I don't know how to do it."

news_list.title: Uber wants to put driverless cabs in key West Asian market— with Chinese AI startup's help
news_list.description: Uber is making another bold move in the autonomous driving space. The ride-hailing giant announced Tuesday (May 6) that it's partnering with China-based Pony.ai to bring the startup's robotaxis to its platform, beginning with a pilot rollout in a key West Asian market later this year. The tie-up marks Uberâs latest step to scale its robotaxi ambitions globally, as it eyes future markets beyond the US.

news_list.title: In Chennai’s Chintadripet, a boxing club gives underprivileged kids a fighting chance
news_list.description: GS Boxing Club in Chintadripet, is one of many young athletes at the GS boxing club who are dedicated to helping children from North Chennai rise socially and economically through boxing, hard work, and perseverance. Ms. Durga has been selected by the Sports Authority of India to compete in international contests, and she trains in Haryana. The club was founded by U. Govindaraj, a boxer

news_list.title: AI as sales manager: JP Morgan says artificial intelligence added wealthy clients despite April market turmoil
news_list.description: JPMorgan’s asset and wealth management division says its AI-powered tools have helped advisers handle a deluge of client requests, boost productivity, and even drive a 20 per cent jump in gross sales between 2023 and 2024. The shift comes as the industry leans further into AI to navigate heightened market volatility and scale services for high-net-worth clients. “When you have a tool that pre-populates all the data and the movement

news_list.title: SC to examine plea challenging NEET-PG 2025 conduct in 2 shifts
news_list.description: India's Supreme Court has agreed to examine a plea by the National Board of Examinations (NBE) to conduct the NEET-PG 2025 entrance exam in two shifts across the country, the court has announced on Monday.The petitioner said it violates Article 14 and Article 21 of the Constitution, which guarantee equality before law and the right to fair opportunity. The petitioner claimed that the conduct of NEET(PG) in twoshifts with different question papers leads

news_list.title: Not neat! Diabetic NEET aspirants barred from taking meds into exam hall
news_list.description: NEET aspirants from across the country have been denied access to essential medicines and food during a test in Hyderabad, officials said on Sunday. The National Testing Agency (NTA) has accused NEET of failing to mention the condition on admit cards. It is not clear what happened after the exam centre staff refused to allow the pouch containing food, medicine and a glucometer into the examination hall. A mother of a 17-year-old aspirant says

news_list.title: Skype to permanently sign off after 21 years as Microsoft retires it, consolidates around Teams
news_list.description: Microsoft announced its intention to sunset Skype, the video-calling app that helped pioneer internet-based voice and video communications, is officially being shut down by Microsoft on Monday (May 5). The move marks the end of a two-decade run for the platform, which first launched in 2003 and quickly became synonymous with VoIP-based video telephony before losing ground to more agile rivals. The shutdown isnât a surprise.

news_list.title: A $40-bn opportunity for India as Apple dumps China for iPhone production
news_list.description: Apple would be able to fulfil 80 percent of its US demand and 100% of its domestic demand, which is increasing every quarter reads more than the average price of iPhones sold in the US during the April-June quarter at $1,100, according to an analyst who told Moneycontrol that Foxconn and Tata Electronics plants in India are well-equipped to satisfy demand worth between $12 and $14 billion. news_list.title: Trump says he’ll extend TikTok deadline again as ByteDance divestiture talks stall over tariffs
news_list.description: US President Donald Trump signalled he is willing to once again extend the deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest TikTokâs US assets, postponing a potential high-stakes tech and geopolitical standoff deeper into the summer. news_list.title: UltraProlink Boost Unity 100, Boost Blade 67, Juice-up Mag 4: Charging solutions for modern needs
news_list.description: The UltraProlink Boost Blade 67 is the slimmest and one of the lightest 67W fast chargers I have ever used. It comes with retractable US power pins (two flat pins) and a detachable Indian power connector that smoothly plugs into it. We tried charging multiple devices simultaneously at up to 45W and 20W speeds through its two USB-C ports, and the performance was satisfactory.

news_list.title: Apple to 'source' most US iPhones from India; Trump tariffs on China to cost it $900 mn
news_list.description: Apple’s sales decline in China, a top official said on Friday. The company will source the majority of the iPhone sold in the US from India in the June quarter while China will produce the vast majority of devices for other markets amid uncertainty over tax tariffs. Cook said the company made quarterly records in several countries, including India.The company, however, recorded the seventh straight quarter of sales decline as it produced the largest volume of iPhones.

news_list.title: Did Tesla try to replace Elon Musk behind the scenes?
news_list.description: The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday that Elon Musk's board of directors had contacted recruitment firms as early as March to explore potential successors due to growing concern over Muskâs increasing involvement in government affairs under the Trump administration, according to a report released by the company's official X account. It was not immediately clear whether it would publish a "DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" before publication.

news_list.title: DeepSeek’s new math model stirs buzz about its mysterious next-gen LLM, R2
news_list.description: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has dropped a surprise upgrade to its math-focused language model, intensifying speculation around its upcoming next-generation reasoning system known simply as R2. While the company has remained tight-lipped about the new model, the sudden release of Prover-V2, a 671-billion-parameter model fine-tuned for mathematical proof-solving, has reignited online chatter across developer and investor communities alike.

news_list.title: Learn about kettlebell lifting, a sport gaining popularity in Tamil Nadu
news_list.description: Kettlebell coach Vignesh Hariharan, who has been a part of the city’s kettlebell training circuit for more than five years, says it is a moment of reckoning as her first attempt to lift and sustain a weight in Goa was a gold medal in the OALC category at the recently-held 12th GSIF Kettlebelt National Championship in Goam on Tuesday.

news_list.title: Climbers from Assam summit unnamed Ladakh peak, honour Lachit Borphukan
news_list.description: Six climbers from Assam have successfully completed a six-day ascent of a 6,365-metre peak in Ladakh, according to the National Park Service (NRS). The expedition has been named after the Ahom general Lachit Borphukan and was launched on 14 April. It marks the first known ascent by six climbers who reached the peak on their second attempt. They were led by Manash Barooah and Shek

news_list.title: Women with disabilities get exclusive space to train, exercise in Chennai
news_list.description: Ms. Nathiya was forced to complete her routine in one-and-a-half hours,” she told the Associated Press. “I can train for three hours. Every piece of equipment is spaced with a wheelchair in mind, nobody is hurrying me to finish my set. I can access the dumbbells and weights myself. The independence to train by myself has been liberating,” she said. But it’s not easy to find an accessible gym

news_list.title: Meet Shashaank Saravanakumar, a young para cyclist breaking barriers in Coimbatore
news_list.description: Shashaank Saravanakumar, a young cyclist from Coimbatore, has made his debut at the first Para-national Road Cycling Championship in Hyderabad on Saturday. He is one of four people who have been selected to represent Tamil Nadu at the para-national road cycling championship in Hyderabad this year. “Cycling means fun and happiness to me. Every ride tells me a story,” he says.
